verses.roman:
tā jalāśayam āsādya
kanyāḥ kamala-locanāḥ
tīre nyasya dukūlāni
vijahruḥ siñcatīr mithaḥ

synonyms: tāḥ—they; jala-āśayam—to the lakeside; āsādya—coming; kanyāḥ—all the girls; kamala-locanāḥ—with eyes like lotus petals; tīre—on the bank; nyasya—giving up; dukūlāni—their dresses; vijahruḥ—began to sport; siñcatīḥ—throwing water; mithaḥ—on one another.
translation: When the young, lotus-eyed girls came to the bank of a reservoir of water, they wanted to enjoy by bathing. Thus they left their clothing on the bank and began sporting, throwing water on one another.
